# Porting Docs

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/index.md): Understand the aspects of upgrading from .NET Framework to .NET, upgrading to the latest .NET, and modernizing your app to the cloud.

## .NET Upgrade Assistant tool

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-overview.md): Learn more about .NET Upgrade Assistant for .NET-related projects. This tool helps you upgrade from older versions of .NET, including .NET Framework, to the latest version of .NET. Code incompatibilities can be fixed as part of the upgrade.
- [Install](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-install.md): Learn how to install .NET Upgrade Assistant as a Visual Studio extension or a .NET Global Tool. .NET Upgrade Assistant assists you when upgrading projects to the latest dependencies or when upgrading to a new .NET
- [How to upgrade](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-how-to-upgrade.md): Learn how to upgrade one or more projects with .NET Upgrade Assistant using either Visual Studio or a terminal.
- [Telemetry](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-telemetry.md): Learn about telemetry collected by the Upgrade Assistant.

## About .NET

- [Versioning info for .NET SDK, MSBuild, and Visual Studio](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/versioning-sdk-msbuild-vs.md): Learn about the versioning relationship between the .NET SDK and MSBuild/VS.

## Analyze

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-analyze-overview.md): Describes how the code analysis function of .NET Upgrade Assistant works. The analysis generates a report that lists what aspects of your project will be upgraded, and if any manual work is involved.
- [How to analyze a project](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-how-to-analyze.md): Learn how to analyze one or more projects with .NET Upgrade Assistant. Before upgrading, it's a good idea to perform code analysis on your projects so that you understand if extra effort is required after upgrading.

## Application porting guides

- [C++/CLI projects](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/cpp-cli.md): Learn about porting C++/CLI projects to .NET.

## Assess the portability of your project

- [Unsupported dependencies](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/third-party-deps.md): Learn how to analyze external dependencies to port your project from .NET Framework to .NET.
- [Use the Windows Compatibility Pack](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/windows-compat-pack.md): Learn about the Windows Compatibility Pack and how can you use it to port existing .NET Framework code to .NET.
- [Unavailable technologies](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/net-framework-tech-unavailable.md): Learn about .NET Framework technologies that are unavailable on .NET 6 and later versions.

## Breaking changes

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/breaking-changes.md): Breaking changes can occur when porting your code from .NET framework to .NET and between versions of .NET. This article describes categories of breaking changes, ways a change can affect compatibility and how to find breaking changes.

## Create a porting plan

- [Approaches](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/porting-approaches.md): Create a porting plan that best reflects your project and context.
- [Project structure](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/project-structure.md): Help for project owners who want to compile their solution against .NET Framework and .NET side by side.

## Plan an upgrade from .NET Framework

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/framework-overview.md): Understand the porting process and discover tools you might find helpful when porting a .NET Framework project to .NET.

## Post-upgrade

- [Modernize](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/modernize.md): This article demonstrates some of the ways you can modernize a .NET Framework app after you've upgraded to .NET

## Pre-upgrade
